intro: Amsinckia scouleri, commonly known as the California fritillary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branching. Amsinckia scouleri is a short-lived perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer.
